text.p: Danish coach Tommy Moller-Nielsen joined Glasgow Rangers on Tuesday as the Scottish champions continued their drive for European glory.
Moller-Nielsen, whose father Richard led Denmark to European championship success in 1992, will join the club as assistant to manager Walter Smith.
The former Faroe Islands national coach joins two other Danes at the club -- national captain Brian Laudrup and striker Erik Bo Anderson.
"This is only the start, we'll also be signing nine new players this summer," said club chairman David Murray. "We must go forward, especially in Europe."
Rangers clinched their ninth successive league title this season, but have failed to impress in Europe.
